game_description: Looking to transform the way you read? Look no further than XR Reader Application, a revolutionary new AR/VR reading application. With XR Reader, you'll be able to dive into your favorite books like never before, with captivating novels, thrilling mysteries, and more all seamlessly integrated into your physical environment. XR Reader takes things to the next level with a selection of immersive virtual environments, allowing you to customize your reading experience and choose the adventure that's right for you. Whether you prefer an AR environment or a fully virtual world, XR Reader has a variety of settings to suit your tastes. But XR Reader isn't just about the environments. It's also about the books themselves. With a vast library of free books spanning multiple genres and featuring both established and emerging authors, XR Reader offers a treasure trove of literary adventures waiting to be unlocked. And if that's not enough, you can even import your own PDF, and EPUB files to create an AR reading experience like never before. But that's not all. XR Reader also features advanced AI technology that allows you to create your own custom stories, generating graphic novels, comics, anime, and children's books tailored specifically to your interests and preferences. The possibilities are truly endless, and you'll be able to experience the limitless potential of generative storytelling.
review_1: To import an ePub file you must Connect glasses to pc by USB port. Then glasses appears as a memory USB in pc. You must copy your ePub file in android/data/xrReader. The file will appear in xr import menu. Press to import
review_2: I been waiting for an reading application like this for years! I always wanted to try reading in AR, and the quality is perfect. I also love the custom story creation feature, where I was able to create custom Anime with my children and read it through the application. Great job on here!
review_3: How do the ai generated stories work? I select a prompt and genre and press submit and it says it will appear in my library in a few minutes, but it never does.
review_4: Can someone tell me how to import my own books to use?
